about.h1: Full control of your wealth, without compromising on security.
about.section1Text: We started with a real question: why do you have to choose between the inconvenience of Excel or the risk of sharing your broker credentials when analyzing your investments? DonkyCapital is the answer. Built by people who invest every day, for those seeking advanced analysis without sacrificing privacy.
about.section2Text: Unlike traditional trackers, we will never have access to your banking data. A simple export from your brokers and DonkyCapital transforms raw data into strategic insights in seconds. Simple, secure, unbreakable.
about.section2Title: Your security isn't a feature, it's our foundation.
about.section3Text: Every portfolio has a different story and your dashboard should reflect your goals. With our modular system, build your command center through fully customizable dashboards: you define the KPIs that matter, monitor asset allocation, and manage rebalancing according to your criteria.

questions.question: Why is DonkyCapital the best investment Excel alternative?
questions.answer: It is a smart Portfolio Tracker that eliminates manual data entry, providing real-time ETF/Stock prices and automatic exposure analysis.

questions.question: Do I need to share my broker credentials?
questions.answer: Never. We prioritize privacy: you simply import your data via CSV/PDF files without ever sharing your broker login details.

questions.question: Can I export Scalable Capital data without Prime+?
questions.answer: Yes! With our free Chrome Extension, you can download your transaction CSV even on the Free plan, saving the Prime+ subscription cost.

questions.question: DonkyCapital vs Getquin: what are the differences?
questions.answer: DonkyCapital offers deeper dashboard customization and superior privacy by avoiding direct broker account linking.

questions.question: What assets can I import?
questions.answer: You can track ETFs, stocks, bonds, crypto, and non-listed funds. It is a comprehensive multi-asset portfolio tracker.

questions.question: Can I use it on mobile?
questions.answer: Yes, DonkyCapital is a PWA (Progressive Web App). Install it on your mobile device for seamless tracking without needing an App Store download.

questions.question: What happens to my data?
questions.answer: Your data is stored securely in Europe and encrypted. We prioritize your privacy and never ask for your broker credentials.

faq.answer: Yes, just use Google Chrome or a Chromium-based browser.

scalableCapital.intro: If you use Scalable Capital to invest in ETFs, stocks, or mutual funds, you've probably wondered how to track all your operations easily and quickly. In this complete guide, I will explain how to export your transactions from Scalable Capital using the Chrome extension "Scalable Capital Transaction Exporter" and how to import them into DonkyCapital, the portfolio tracker that allows you to manage all your investments in a single dashboard, without using complicated Excel sheets.
scalableCapital.pageDescription: Complete guide to exporting transactions from Scalable Capital even without a PRIME+ account and importing them into DonkyCapital, with views on assets, balancing, exposure, and performance.
scalableCapital.pageTitle: How to export Scalable Capital transactions and import them into DonkyCapital
privacyList: The extension does not send data to external servers: everything happens in your browser.
DonkyCapital does not require broker login credentials to import CSV/Excel files.
You can save exported files on your computer or a personal cloud without risks.
step1List: Open Google Chrome on your computer.
Go to the official extension page: Scalable Capital Transaction Exporter on Chrome Web Store.
Click on "Add to Chrome" and confirm the installation.
Once installed, you will see the extension icon near the address bar.
scalableCapital.step1Tip: Tip: Always keep the extension updated to ensure it works correctly with new versions of Scalable Capital.
scalableCapital.step2Highlight: Even without a PRIME+ account, you can get all transactions and import them into DonkyCapital for complete portfolio management.
step2List: Log in to your Scalable Capital account.
Go to the "Transactions" or "Order History" section.
Select the desired time period (e.g., last 12 months).
Click on the Download icon of the Chrome extension.
Choose the file format to export: CSV, Excel, or JSON.
scalableCapital.step2Text: The exported file contains all the main information: transaction date, asset title (ETF, stock, or fund), quantity, price, and type of operation (buy, sell, dividend).
scalableCapital.step3Highlight: This level of analysis is not available on the Scalable Capital website, which is limited to historical transactions.
step3List: Log in to DonkyCapital.com and open your account.
Choose the portfolio to import transactions into and select "Import Transactions".
Upload the CSV file exported from Scalable Capital.
Confirm and wait for the file to be processed.
step3ReportList: Comparison between multiple portfolios if you manage several.
scalableCapital.step3Text: In a few seconds, all your transactions will be visible in the DonkyCapital dashboard, with detailed reports on:
tipsList: Export data regularly, for example every month, so DonkyCapital is always up to date.
Keep CSV/Excel files in a dedicated folder on your PC to always have a backup copy.
Always check the data after importing to verify that all transactions are correct.
Take advantage of the fact that even free accounts can get all the necessary information without having to subscribe to a PRIME+ plan.
scalableCapital.whyDonkyQuote: In other words, DonkyCapital allows you to see what Scalable Capital doesn't show you: total control of your portfolio.
scalableCapital.whyDonkyText1: The Scalable Capital website only shows transaction history and some basic investment information. It doesn't offer a complete portfolio view in terms of:
scalableCapital.whyDonkyText2: With DonkyCapital, however, you can have a complete and personalized dashboard, where you can view your entire wealth at a glance, analyze the progress of your investments, and make more informed decisions.
scalableCapital.whyDonkyTitle: Why use DonkyCapital instead of the Scalable Capital website
whyExportList: Download your transactions in CSV, Excel (XLSX) even without a PRIME+ account;
Keep all data on your device, without sending it to external servers;
Use exported files for personal analysis or import them into DonkyCapital;
Get detailed reports without additional costs.
scalableCapital.whyExportQuote: This means that even those with a free account can finally get all the information on their transactions and have complete control over their portfolio.
scalableCapital.whyExportText1: Scalable Capital is one of the most used brokers in Europe, thanks to its modern and intuitive platforms. However, many transaction export functions are only available to PRIME+ customers.
scalableCapital.whyExportText2: If you don't want to pay for an additional plan or simply want more control over your data, the Chrome extension Scalable Capital Transaction Exporter is the ideal solution.
scalableCapital.whyExportTitle: Why export data from Scalable Capital

descriptions.allocation-breakdown: Analytical table listing weight, value, and performance for each category.
descriptions.heatmap: Heat map visually comparing performance and weight by category.
descriptions.holdings-summary: Complete list of currently open positions with ALP and performance.
descriptions.performance-metrics: Synthetic overview of the portfolio with five key indicators.
descriptions.performance-table: Performance over 6 time horizons with trend icons (1D, 1W, 1M, 3M, 6M, 1Y).
descriptions.pie-chart: Pie chart displaying portfolio percentage distribution.
descriptions.portfolio-table: Complete table listing all portfolios with their key values.
descriptions.portfolio-trends: Temporal evolution of portfolio value with stacked area chart.
descriptions.profit-loss: Complete view of portfolio profits and losses.
descriptions.stack-chart: Displays the percentage composition of the portfolio over time.
descriptions.transactions-list: List of the latest transactions in chronological order.

fineco.pageTitle: Fineco Portfolio Tracker: How to Import Your Fineco Portfolio to DonkyCapital
fineco.intro: If you use Fineco to invest in ETFs, stocks, or mutual funds, you can now easily track all your operations with DonkyCapital. In this complete guide, I'll explain how to export your Fineco portfolio directly from the platform (no extensions needed) and how to import it into DonkyCapital, the portfolio tracker that lets you manage all your investments in a single advanced dashboard.
fineco.whyExportTitle: Why Export Your Portfolio from Fineco
fineco.whyExportText1: Fineco is one of Italy's most innovative banks, with a complete trading platform and competitive commissions.
fineco.whyExportText2: Exporting data from Fineco is simple and straightforward: no extensions or third-party tools needed. Just access the Reports section and download the Excel file with all your transactions.
whyExportList: Easily export all operations in XLSX format directly from Fineco;
Keep all data on your device, without sharing login credentials;
Import files into DonkyCapital for advanced analysis;
Get detailed reports on asset allocation, performance, and risk.
fineco.whyExportQuote: With DonkyCapital, you transform Fineco's raw data into strategic insights to optimize your portfolio.
fineco.whyDonkyTitle: Why Use DonkyCapital Instead of Fineco's Platform
fineco.whyDonkyText1: Fineco's platform provides transaction history and basic reporting. However, it doesn't offer advanced analysis such as:
whyDonkyList: Detailed analysis of sector and geographic exposure;
Multi-portfolio comparison if you have investments across multiple platforms;
Automatic calculation of time-weighted and money-weighted performance;
Alerts and notifications on rebalancing and asset allocation.
fineco.whyDonkyText2: With DonkyCapital, you centralize all your investments (Fineco, Degiro, Scalable Capital, Moneyfarm, etc.) in a single professional dashboard.
fineco.whyDonkyQuote: DonkyCapital gives you total control of your wealth, with analysis that Fineco doesn't provide natively.
fineco.step1Title: Step 1 — Access Fineco and Go to the Reports Section
step1List: Log in to the Fineco platform with your credentials;
From the home page, go to the "Portfolio" section;
fineco.step1Tip: Tip: Export your entire transaction history for complete analysis in DonkyCapital.
step2List: On the "Orders and Accounting" page, select the reference period (recommended: from inception to date);
Click the "Export to Excel" or "Download" button;
The .xlsx file will be downloaded to your computer;
Save the file in an easily accessible folder.
fineco.step2Text: The Excel file contains all information about your operations: date, instrument, quantity, price, fees, and total amount.
fineco.step2Highlight: Fineco allows direct export without the need for browser extensions or third-party tools.
fineco.step3Title: Step 3 — Import the File into DonkyCapital
step3List: Log in to DonkyCapital.com and open your account;
Select the portfolio to import data into;
Upload the .xlsx file exported from Fineco;
Confirm the import and wait for processing (a few seconds).
fineco.step3Text: In a few seconds, all your Fineco transactions will be visible in the DonkyCapital dashboard, with detailed reports on:
step3ReportList: Comparison with benchmarks and other portfolios.
fineco.step3Highlight: This level of analysis is not natively available on Fineco, which focuses primarily on trading rather than strategic asset allocation.

faq.question: Do I need to modify the Excel file before importing?
faq.answer: No. Upload the file exactly as you export it from Fineco. DonkyCapital automatically recognizes the format and imports all transactions.

faq.question: Does DonkyCapital require Fineco login credentials?
faq.answer: Absolutely not. DonkyCapital never has access to your banking credentials. Import happens via Excel files that you export and upload manually.

faq.question: Can I import multiple Fineco portfolios?
faq.answer: Yes, you can create separate portfolios in DonkyCapital and import data from each Fineco account separately, or merge them into a single consolidated portfolio.

faq.question: How does DonkyCapital handle Fineco fees?
faq.answer: DonkyCapital automatically imports fees from the Fineco Excel file and includes them in the calculation of your portfolio's actual performance.

multiBroker.pageTitle: Complete Portfolio Tracking Guide: How to Track Investments Across Multiple Brokers (2026)
introParagraphs: You have an account on Scalable Capital for ETF savings plans, use Degiro for US stocks, keep bonds on Directa for tax optimization, and maybe have a hardware wallet for Crypto.
If this sounds familiar, you already know the problem: total chaos.

Accessing 4 different apps to understand your net worth is frustrating. Even worse is having no idea of your true risk exposure. How much does the S&P 500 really weigh in your total? Are you overexposed to tech without knowing it?

In this definitive Portfolio Tracking guide, we'll see exactly how to aggregate all your investments into one professional dashboard, the metrics that truly matter (beyond simple gains), and how to do it while keeping your data 100% private.
tocItems: Tracking Methods: Excel vs Apps vs Hybrid
What to Track: The Complete Checklist
Metrics: TWR vs IRR (and why P&L lies)
section1Content: Many investors fall into the trap of mentally compartmentalizing their money. "This is retirement money on Scalable", "This is trading money on Degiro".
Without an aggregated view (Portfolio Tracking), you risk:
section1Risks: Asset Overlap: You might buy a World ETF on one broker and a Tech ETF on another, ending up with 40% of your portfolio in Apple and Microsoft unintentionally.
Tax Inefficiency: Not seeing capital gains and losses in one screen makes it difficult to plan tax loss harvesting.
Asset Allocation Drift: You wanted a 60/40 stocks/bonds allocation, but market movements brought you to 80/20. Without unified tracking, you don't notice and don't rebalance.
multiBroker.section2Title: 2. Tracking Methods: Excel vs Automated Apps vs Hybrid
multiBroker.section2Intro: In 2026, you essentially have three ways to monitor your portfolio.
multiBroker.section2MethodAPro: Infinite customization, free, no data sharing.
multiBroker.section2MethodACon: You must enter data manually, formulas break ("#REF!"), retrieving real-time prices is complex (Google Finance often fails on European tickers or local exchanges).
multiBroker.section2MethodBCon: Privacy: you must provide login credentials or API tokens to third parties. Connections often drop, requiring continuous reconnections.
multiBroker.section2MethodCPro: Maximum Privacy (you never share your broker password), automated calculations (the software does everything), penny-accurate data.
multiBroker.section2MethodCCon: Requires 30 seconds per month to upload the updated file.
multiBroker.section2Verdict: The verdict: If you care about the security of your financial data but don't want to go crazy with Excel, the "Data Import" approach is the gold standard of 2026.
multiBroker.section3Title: 3. What to Track: The Complete Checklist
multiBroker.section3Intro: Good tracking doesn't just look at the "Current Price". For total control, your dashboard must include:
section3Items: Asset Class: Stocks, Bonds, ETFs, Crypto, Cash, P2P Lending.
Geography: How exposed are you to the US? And Europe?
Currency: Too many assets in USD? If the Euro strengthens, your portfolio drops. You need to know.
Sectors: Technology, Healthcare, Energy. Sector diversification is your insurance against specific crises.
Costs (TER & Fees): Often hidden, they erode compound returns.
multiBroker.section4Title: 4. Essential Metrics: TWR vs IRR (and why P&L lies)
multiBroker.section4Intro: If you only look at the absolute P&L (Profit & Loss) (e.g. "+€500"), you're not understanding how you invest. Here are the two king metrics you'll find on advanced platforms like DonkyCapital:
multiBroker.section4TWRContent: Measures manager skill (yourself) by eliminating the effect of deposits/withdrawals. Essential for comparing your performance against a benchmark (e.g. S&P 500). If you deposit €10,000 and the market is flat, your value goes up, but your TWR stays at 0%. Correct.
multiBroker.section4MWRContent: Takes into account the timing of your cash flows. If you're good at "buying the dip", your MWR will be higher than your TWR.
multiBroker.section4Tip: Use TWR to understand if your strategy works compared to the market. Use IRR to understand how much you're actually earning in your pocket.
multiBroker.section5Error1: Ignoring Dividends: Many Excel sheets only track price. If you invest in Dividend Aristocrats, you could be underestimating your return by 3-4% annually.
multiBroker.section5Error2: Forgetting Cash: Cash is a position! If 50% of your portfolio is liquid waiting to invest, your risk is low. If you don't track it, you think you're 100% invested.
multiBroker.section5Error3: Wrong Benchmarking: Don't compare a 60/40 portfolio with the S&P 500 (100% stocks). You'll always feel like you're losing during bull markets, pushing you to take too much risk.
multiBroker.section6Intro: For a European investor using brokers like Scalable Capital, Degiro, Moneyfarm or Directa, the tool choice is critical.
multiBroker.section6EditorContent: DonkyCapital was born to solve the privacy problem and the complexity of Excel. It's a Progressive Web App (PWA), so it works on desktop and mobile like a native app, but without going through app stores.
multiBroker.section6Feature1: Zero Credentials: You never have to give your broker password. It works by importing the files your broker already provides.
multiBroker.section6Feature2: Scalable Capital "Hack": Scalable requires the Prime+ plan to see detailed performance. DonkyCapital offers a free Chrome extension that extracts your data from Scalable (even Free plan) and analyzes it for free.
multiBroker.section6Feature3: Customizable Dashboards: Unlike other rigid tools, here you can move widgets, create pie charts or heatmaps as you please.
multiBroker.section7Title: 7. Step-by-Step Setup: Unify Your Portfolio in 5 Minutes
multiBroker.section7Intro: Here's how to set up professional tracking using DonkyCapital (taking advantage of the Free Early Access period).
multiBroker.section7Step1Content: Go to DonkyCapital.com and sign up. Currently the first 100 users get lifetime Premium features for free.
multiBroker.section7Step2Title: Step 2: Get Your Data from the Broker
section7Step2Items: Scalable Capital: Use the DonkyCapital Chrome extension if you have the Free plan, or download the report from "Profile -> Taxes/Documents".
Others (Directa/Moneyfarm/Trade Republic): Download the PDF or CSV of transactions.
multiBroker.section7Step3Content:
In the DonkyCapital dashboard, click "Import Portfolio", select your broker and drag the file.
The system will automatically recognize tickers, dates, prices and fees.
multiBroker.section7Step4Content: Now you have access to the Sector Heatmap (to see if you're overexposed to Tech or Finance) and the Dividend chart. Configure the dashboard by dragging the widgets you care about most to the top.
multiBroker.section8FAQ1Q: Is it safe to upload my broker files?
multiBroker.section8FAQ1A: Yes. CSV/PDF files only contain transaction history. They don't contain passwords, nor allow fund withdrawals. Data on DonkyCapital is encrypted and servers are in Europe (GDPR compliant).
multiBroker.section8FAQ2A: Absolutely yes. You can merge in the same chart your stock portfolio on Degiro and your Bitcoin on Ledger/Binance to see your total wealth.
multiBroker.section8FAQ3A: Yes, DonkyCapital is a PWA. You can add it to your iPhone or Android home screen and use it like a native app.
multiBroker.ctaDescription: We're opening the Early Access Program. The first users will receive Premium features forever, for free.
multiBroker.ctaNote: Includes automated import for Scalable, Degiro, Directa and more.

vsGetquin.pageTitle: DonkyCapital vs Getquin: Best Portfolio Tracker for Privacy & Control (2026 Review)
vsGetquin.intro1: 2026 is the year when the conscious investor stops blindly trusting broken Excel files and starts looking for professional tools. If you've landed here, you've probably heard of Getquin, the social tracking giant, but you're wondering if there's a more private, flexible, and perhaps less "noisy" alternative.
vsGetquin.intro2: In this article we analyze DonkyCapital and Getquin side by side. We won't just tell you which one to use, but help you understand which one fits your investing style: are you a "set it and forget it" investor or an analyst who wants total control over your data?
vsGetquin.multiBrokerP1: Today the average European investor has an account on one broker for tax-advantaged investing, perhaps Degiro or Scalable Capital for foreign ETFs, and a crypto wallet. The result? You never know your true Net Worth in real time.
vsGetquin.multiBrokerP2: Both DonkyCapital and Getquin solve this problem, but they do it with diametrically opposite philosophies.
vsGetquin.getquinSubtitle: Getquin: The Social Network of Finance
vsGetquin.getquinDesc: Getquin was born with the idea of making investing "social". It's a great app if you like comparing your portfolio with others, reading news feeds, and having an experience very similar to a social network. It's all about automation: connect your bank and it does the rest.
vsGetquin.donkyDesc: DonkyCapital was born for those who hate giving bank passwords to apps. It positions itself as the "ultimate Excel replacement". It's not a social network; it's a professional analysis tool. It's all about privacy (your data stays yours), customization (drag & drop dashboards) and deep analysis (heatmaps, granular P&L).
vsGetquin.featureIntro: Here's how the two contenders perform in the critical areas for an investor:
vsGetquin.tableRowImportDonky: File Import / No-Login. Import PDF/CSV or use the browser extension. No bank password required.
vsGetquin.tableRowImportGetquin: Open Banking. Connect your bank/broker account directly via API.
vsGetquin.tableRowPrivacyDonky: Maximum. Your financial data is not linked to bank credentials.
vsGetquin.tableRowPrivacyGetquin: Limited. Requires read access to your bank accounts, or device credentials for brokers that don't support read-only mode.
vsGetquin.tableRowPlatformDonky: Web & PWA. Accessible anywhere, installable as a lightweight app, optimized for Desktop/Tablet.
vsGetquin.tableRowPlatformGetquin: Mobile App. Born as a native app (iOS/Android), strong focus on smartphone usage.
vsGetquin.tableRowCustomDonky: Total. Modular dashboards, movable widgets, 48+ analytical views.
vsGetquin.tableRowCustomGetquin: Standard. Predefined layout, less flexibility in data visualization.
vsGetquin.tableRowKillerDonky: Scalable Free Export. Export data from Scalable Capital without paying Prime+ thanks to the proprietary extension.
vsGetquin.tableRowKillerGetquin: Social Benchmark. See how your portfolio performs compared to the community.
vsGetquin.tableRowPriceGetquin: Freemium (Basic features free, advanced analytics behind paywall ~€90/year).
vsGetquin.privacyTitle: Deep Dive: The Privacy & Import Question
vsGetquin.privacyIntro: This is the breaking point for many users.
vsGetquin.chooseGetquin: Choose Getquin if: You don't mind sharing your broker login credentials (read-only) via third-party providers. You want a stock you buy on Trade Republic to magically appear in the app within minutes.
vsGetquin.chooseDonky: Choose DonkyCapital if: The thought of entering your bank username and password into an external app gives you chills. DonkyCapital uses a "Zero-Knowledge" approach to credentials: you upload transaction files or use the Chrome extension.
vsGetquin.scalableBonus: Bonus for Scalable Capital users: DonkyCapital offers a free extension that lets you download transaction CSVs even on Scalable's Free plan (which normally prevents it), saving you the cost of a Prime+ subscription.
vsGetquin.scalableGuideLink: Read the guide: How to export CSV from Scalable without Prime+
vsGetquin.dashboardIntro: While Getquin shows you an Instagram-like feed with news about your stocks, DonkyCapital welcomes you with a dashboard that looks like a hedge fund manager's desk.
vsGetquin.donkyScreenCaption: Dashboard with drag & drop widgets, multi-broker performance chart and asset class allocation
vsGetquin.getquinScreenCaption: Portfolio with performance chart and allocation locked behind Premium paywall
vsGetquin.dashboardFeature1: Sector Heatmaps: See at a glance if you're overexposed to Tech or Energy.
vsGetquin.dashboardFeature2: Multi-Period P&L: Analyze returns not just "total", but by quarter, year, or specific month.
vsGetquin.dashboardFeature3: Customizable Widgets: Want the pie chart on the left and the dividend list on the right? Move them. You decide what to see.
vsGetquin.pricingGetquin: Getquin offers a lot for free, but deep analysis features (like portfolio X-ray) are often behind a "Premium" paywall that can be costly on an annual basis.
vsGetquin.pricingDonky: DonkyCapital is launching an Early Access program. Currently, the first users can access all Premium features (multi-portfolio, unlimited transactions, 8 dashboards) for free during the beta phase. At full launch, the Standard plan will start at a very competitive price (around €5.99/month), making it a very affordable Getquin alternative for those managing multiple portfolios (or financial advisors managing clients).
vsGetquin.verdictGetquin:
Winner for "Social & Mobile": Getquin
If you want to invest from the couch and compare with friends, Getquin remains a great consumer choice.
vsGetquin.verdictDonky:
Winner for "Analysis & Privacy": DonkyCapital
If you're an investor who takes your data seriously, use multiple brokers (like Degiro, Directa, Scalable) and want a unified dashboard without security risks, DonkyCapital is the best choice. Its PWA nature makes it perfect for those who love analyzing charts on any screen without giving up mobile access.
vsGetquin.ctaTitle: Tired of giving away your data or going crazy with Excel?
vsGetquin.ctaDesc: DonkyCapital is opening its doors to the first 100 users for Early Access. Get all Premium features Free forever (until the end of beta).
vsGetquin.ctaButton: Create Your Free Dashboard on DonkyCapital
vsGetquin.ctaNote: No credit card required. No bank password required.
